summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (P5521.06) establishing policy and procedures for searches of housing units, inmates, and inmate work areas. It details various search methods (electronic, pat, visual, digital/instrument, dry cell status, and medical x-ray), with specific rules regarding cross-gender searches, transgender inmates, and compliance with the Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA). It is a general policy document, not specific to any individual case.

persons.name: Charles E. Samuels, Jr.
persons.context: Approved the Program Statement as the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Policy Effective Date
events.description: The rules outlined in Program Statement P5521.06 become effective.

keyFacts: This is a standard Bureau of Prisons policy document (P5521.06) on inmate and facility search procedures, dated June 4, 2015.
The policy explicitly prohibits cross-gender pat-down searches of female inmates absent exigent circumstances, in accordance with PREA standards.
It establishes specific procedures for pat searches of transgender inmates, requiring Warden-authorized exceptions based on consultation with health and correctional services staff.
The document details the protocol for 'dry cell' status (close observation), used when an inmate is suspected of ingesting or concealing contraband in a body cavity.
It outlines the strict authorization chain required for medical x-ray examinations to search for contraband, requiring Warden and Regional Director approval.
